definitions.definition: (of an object taller than its width and depth) An inclination away from the vertical.
definitions.example: The trees had various leans toward gaps in the canopy.

definitions.definition: To incline, deviate, or bend, from a vertical position; to be in a position thus inclining or deviating.
definitions.example: She leaned out of the window.

definitions.definition: To incline in opinion or desire; to conform in conduct; often with to, toward, etc.
definitions.example: I’m leaning towards voting Conservative in the next election.  The Hispanic vote leans Democratic.

definitions.definition: Followed by against, on, or upon: to rest or rely, for support, comfort, etc.
Meat with no fat on it.
An organism that is lean in stature.
To thin out (a fuel-air mixture): to reduce the fuel flow into the mixture so that there is more air or oxygen.
(of a person or animal) Slim; not fleshy.
Having little extra or little to spare; scanty; meagre.
Having a low proportion or concentration of a desired substance or ingredient.
definitions.example: A lean ore hardly worth mining.

definitions.definition: Of a character which prevents the compositor from earning the usual wages; opposed to fat.
Efficient, economic, frugal, agile, slimmed-down; pertaining to the modern industrial principles of "lean manufacturing"
definitions.example: Alcoa is now a lean and agile enterprise, after having split last year into two entities.

definitions.definition: A recreational drug based on codeine-laced promethazine cough syrup, popular in the hip hop community in the southeastern United States.
